name: Downy Pincushion Plant, Purple navarretia
overview:
Grows on hill slopes, remains sensitive in vernal pool areas. Blooms from April to June and is not endangered.
Annual herb.
habitat: Native to the central mountain ranges, Central Valley of California, and to southern Oregon. Found in chaparral, oak woodlands, and foothill woodland habitats.
tags: hairy red brown stem needle-like lobes leaves clustered upper hairy leaves lower leaves hairless flowers blue purple
